meanings.definition: A stick or rod one yard long, used as a standard unit of measurement.
meanings.sent1: She measured the fabric with a yardstick to ensure it was the right length.
meanings.sent2: The yardstick showed that the table was exactly three yards long.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the yardstick was a toy and tried to play with it.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to accuracy made him the yardstick by which all others were measured.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow color of the yardstick made it easy to spot in the toolbox.

meanings.definition: A standard or criterion for comparison.
meanings.sent1: In her opinion, kindness should be the yardstick for measuring a person's character.
meanings.sent2: The yardstick for success in their company was based on sales performance.
meanings.sent3: Using ice cream flavors as a yardstick for decision-making may not be the most effective method.
meanings.sent4: His patience under pressure became the yardstick for handling difficult situations.
meanings.sent5: The yardstick of customer satisfaction was crucial for the business to thrive.
